description: Mirroring involves repeating the last few words or a key phrase the other person has said. It encourages them to elaborate and shows you’re actively listening.
purpose: Build rapport, gather more information, and encourage the other party to keep talking.

example.scenario: A colleague says, 'This deadline is going to be tough to meet.'
example.outcome: The colleague expands, 'Yes, we’re short on resources, and the client keeps changing the requirements.'

scenarios.scenario: During your annual review, you mention wanting a salary increase. Your manager replies, 'We value your work, but the budget is tight right now.'
scenarios.correctOption: So, you’re saying the budget is tight right now?
wrongOptions: I need this raise to match my market value.
If you can’t approve it, I’ll need to consider other opportunities.

scenarios.scenario: A customer says during a sales pitch, 'I think this product is too expensive for us.'
scenarios.correctOption: Too expensive?
wrongOptions: Our prices are competitive for the value we provide.
What makes you feel that way?

scenarios.scenario: A supplier tells you, 'We can't offer better terms at this moment.'
scenarios.correctOption: Can't offer better terms?
wrongOptions: Why can’t you offer us more flexible terms?
What do we need to do to qualify for better terms?

scenarios.scenario: Your coworker says, 'I have too many tasks on my plate already.'
scenarios.correctOption: Too many tasks?
wrongOptions: Why do you think the workload isn’t distributed fairly?
Let’s just focus on finishing the project.

scenarios.scenario: A client mentions, 'I'm not sure we can adjust the project deadline.'
scenarios.correctOption: Adjust the project deadline?
wrongOptions: We need more time because of unexpected delays.
How flexible can you be with the deadline?

scenarios.scenario: A vendor says, 'Providing a discount isn't possible at this time.'
scenarios.correctOption: Isn't possible?
wrongOptions: What’s the best price you can offer?
Why don’t you consider a smaller discount?

scenarios.scenario: Your partner says, 'We have been overspending lately.'
scenarios.correctOption: Overspending?
wrongOptions: Why do you think our budget is out of control?
We need to cut back expenses immediately.

scenarios.scenario: A team member comments, 'I'm not sure about this new process you're suggesting.'
scenarios.correctOption: Not sure?
wrongOptions: Let me show you why this is the best option.
We’re implementing this whether you like it or not.

scenarios.scenario: Your landlord says, 'I'm planning to increase the rent next month.'
scenarios.correctOption: Increase the rent?
wrongOptions: Why do you think a rent increase is necessary?
What would it take to keep the rent the same?

scenarios.scenario: In a meeting, a stakeholder says, 'This proposal seems too risky for us.'
scenarios.correctOption: Too risky?
wrongOptions: Let me explain why this idea will work.
Why do you think this is a risky move?

scenarios.scenario: A prospect tells you, 'I don't think this service is the right fit for us.'
scenarios.correctOption: Not the right fit?
wrongOptions: Why do you think this isn’t a good fit?
Let me explain why this service is perfect for you.

scenarios.scenario: A potential client says, 'We need a significant discount to consider your product.'
scenarios.correctOption: Significant discount?
wrongOptions: Why do you feel our product isn’t worth the full price?
Our pricing is already competitive.

scenarios.scenario: During a demo, the client says, 'I'm not sure this product suits our needs.'
scenarios.correctOption: Not sure it suits your needs?
wrongOptions: What makes you feel that way?
Our product is designed to fit most needs.

scenarios.scenario: An existing client mentions, 'We're hesitant to place a larger order right now.'
scenarios.correctOption: Hesitant to place a larger order?
wrongOptions: Why don’t you think this is a good idea?
Let me explain the benefits of a larger order.

scenarios.scenario: A customer says, 'Your competitor offers a cheaper alternative.'
scenarios.correctOption: Cheaper alternative?
wrongOptions: Our product offers better value in the long run.
What specifically about their pricing appeals to you?

scenarios.scenario: A client tells you, 'We need more time to make a decision.'
scenarios.correctOption: Need more time?
wrongOptions: Why do you think you need more time?
What’s stopping you from making a decision today?

scenarios.scenario: A prospect hasn't responded, and when you reach out, they say, 'We've lost interest for now.'
scenarios.correctOption: Lost interest?
wrongOptions: Why haven’t you responded?
Let’s revisit our last conversation.

scenarios.scenario: A client says, 'I'm not convinced about upgrading to a higher-tier package.'
scenarios.correctOption: Not convinced about upgrading?
wrongOptions: Why don’t you see the value in upgrading?
Let me show you why this is a better option.

scenarios.scenario: During a pitch, someone says, 'We have reservations about this solution.'
scenarios.correctOption: Reservations?
wrongOptions: Let me address each of your objections one by one.
Why do you think this solution isn’t ideal?

scenarios.scenario: An executive responds to your meeting request with, 'I'm not interested in this proposal.'
scenarios.correctOption: Not interested?
wrongOptions: What can I say to change your mind?
Let me explain why this meeting will benefit you.

description: Labeling involves identifying and verbalizing the other person’s emotions or concerns. Use phrases like, 'It sounds like…,' 'It seems like…,' or 'It looks like…' to reflect their feelings.
purpose: Show empathy, build trust, and diffuse negative emotions.

example.scenario: A client says, 'I’m not sure this product is worth the cost.'
example.response: It sounds like you’re concerned about the return on investment.
example.outcome: The client feels understood and clarifies their concerns: 'Exactly. I need to be sure it will save us time.'

scenarios.scenario: During a discussion about your compensation, your boss says, 'We have limited funds for raises this year.'
scenarios.correctOption: It sounds like you’re worried about budget constraints.
wrongOptions: Why can’t you approve this raise?
Let me explain why I deserve this salary increase.

scenarios.scenario: A potential client says, 'The price is higher than we expected.'
scenarios.correctOption: It seems like you’re concerned about whether this fits your budget.
wrongOptions: Our product is worth the price because of its value.
What exactly makes you hesitant about the cost?

scenarios.scenario: Your supplier tells you, 'Extending better terms isn't feasible for us.'
scenarios.correctOption: It looks like you’re worried about giving us more favorable terms.
wrongOptions: Why can’t you offer us better terms?
Let me show you why these terms are reasonable.

scenarios.scenario: A coworker says, 'I feel like I'm doing more than my share on this project.'
scenarios.correctOption: It seems like you feel overwhelmed with the workload.
wrongOptions: Why do you think the workload is uneven?
Let’s focus on completing the project first.

scenarios.scenario: Your client says, 'Delaying the project isn't an option for us.'
scenarios.correctOption: It sounds like you’re concerned about meeting your internal deadlines.
wrongOptions: Why don’t you want to approve an extension?
We need more time because of unexpected delays.

scenarios.scenario: A vendor mentions, 'Offering a discount would be difficult at this time.'
scenarios.correctOption: It looks like you’re hesitant about offering a larger discount.
wrongOptions: Why can’t you provide us with a better price?
We deserve this discount based on our volume.

scenarios.scenario: Your partner says, 'I'm worried we're spending too much on non-essentials.'
scenarios.correctOption: It sounds like you’re worried about overspending.
wrongOptions: Why do you think we’re spending too much?
We need to stick to our budget more strictly.

scenarios.scenario: A team member says, 'I don't think this new tool will help us.'
scenarios.correctOption: It seems like you’re hesitant about whether this tool will actually help.
wrongOptions: Why don’t you see the value in this tool?
This is the best option we have, so we’re moving forward.

scenarios.scenario: Your landlord says, 'I'm increasing the rent starting next month.'
scenarios.correctOption: It sounds like you’re concerned about rising property costs.
wrongOptions: Why do you think a rent increase is necessary?
Let me explain why this increase isn’t fair.

scenarios.scenario: In a proposal meeting, a stakeholder says, 'This seems like a risky move.'
scenarios.correctOption: It seems like you’re worried about the risks involved in this idea.
wrongOptions: Why do you think this idea is risky?
Let me explain why this is a safe bet.

scenarios.scenario: A potential subscriber says, 'I'm not sure this service is worth it for us.'
scenarios.correctOption: It looks like you’re unsure about the long-term value of this service.
wrongOptions: Why do you think this isn’t worth it?
Let me explain why this service is the best choice for you.

scenarios.scenario: A client requests, 'We need you to lower your price significantly.'
scenarios.correctOption: It seems like you’re worried about affordability.
wrongOptions: Why do you think the product is overpriced?
We can’t lower the price further because of our margins.

scenarios.scenario: During a product demo, the customer says, 'I'm not convinced this will solve our problem.'
scenarios.correctOption: It sounds like you’re concerned about whether this product will meet your specific needs.
wrongOptions: Why do you think this product won’t work for you?
Our product fits a wide range of requirements.

scenarios.scenario: An existing client says, 'We're not ready to increase our order size.'
scenarios.correctOption: It looks like you’re worried about committing to a larger order.
wrongOptions: Why do you think a larger order is a risk?
Let me explain why increasing the order is beneficial.

scenarios.scenario: A customer mentions, 'Another company offers a similar product for less.'
scenarios.correctOption: It seems like you’re worried about cost over value.
wrongOptions: Why do you think their price is better?
Let me explain why our product is worth the cost.

scenarios.scenario: A client says, 'We need to think about this decision a bit longer.'
scenarios.correctOption: It sounds like you’re hesitant to commit because you need more clarity.
wrongOptions: Why do you think you need more time?
What’s stopping you from deciding now?

scenarios.scenario: After reaching out, a prospect replies, 'We're putting this project on hold for now.'
scenarios.correctOption: It seems like you’re unsure about moving forward.
wrongOptions: Why haven’t you responded to my follow-ups?
Let’s revisit our previous conversation.

scenarios.scenario: A client says, 'Upgrading doesn't seem necessary at this point.'
scenarios.correctOption: I understand why you might be hesitant to commit to a higher tier.
wrongOptions: Why don’t you see the value in upgrading?
Let me explain why this higher tier is a better fit.

scenarios.scenario: During your pitch, a decision-maker says, 'We have some concerns about this solution.'
scenarios.correctOption: It seems like you’re concerned about aligning this solution with your goals.
wrongOptions: Why don’t you think this will work?
Let me address each objection in detail.

scenarios.scenario: An executive says, 'I don't think this meeting is necessary.'
scenarios.correctOption: It sounds like you’re not seeing how this meeting would benefit you.
wrongOptions: Why don’t you think this meeting is worthwhile?
Let me explain why this is worth your time.

description: Tactical empathy is about understanding the other person’s perspective and feelings without necessarily agreeing with them. It creates a foundation for collaboration.
purpose: Foster connection, reduce defensiveness, and encourage openness.

example.scenario: A manager says, 'This project isn’t going to work—it’s too risky.'
example.response: I can see why this feels risky given the tight timeline and resource demands.
example.outcome: The manager opens up, and you can discuss ways to mitigate the risks.

scenarios.scenario: Your boss says during a meeting, 'We can't approve raises at this time.'
scenarios.correctOption: I can see why this might be challenging given the current budget limitations.
wrongOptions: You should just approve the raise—it’s deserved.
Why is this so hard to approve?

scenarios.scenario: A client states, 'This solution is too expensive for us.'
scenarios.correctOption: I understand why the cost might feel high when looking at your current expenses.
wrongOptions: The cost is justified based on the value.
Why do you feel the price is too high?

scenarios.scenario: Your supplier says, 'Offering better terms isn't possible under our policy.'
scenarios.correctOption: I get that adjusting terms might feel risky for your margins.
wrongOptions: Why don’t you want to offer better terms?
If you can’t adjust the terms, we’ll need to look elsewhere.

scenarios.scenario: A team member complains, 'I'm swamped with tasks and can't take on more.'
scenarios.correctOption: I can see why it feels like the workload is uneven right now.
wrongOptions: Why do you think it’s uneven?
Let’s just focus on completing the project.

scenarios.scenario: Your client says, 'Extending the deadline isn't feasible for us.'
scenarios.correctOption: I can see why adjusting the timeline might feel disruptive to your plans.
wrongOptions: Why don’t you want to approve this extension?
We need this extension, or the project won’t succeed.

scenarios.scenario: A vendor tells you, 'We can't provide a discount at this level.'
scenarios.correctOption: I understand why offering a larger discount might feel difficult given your pricing structure.
wrongOptions: Why can’t you just lower the price?
This discount is necessary for us to proceed.

scenarios.scenario: Your partner expresses, 'I'm worried we're not saving enough for our future.'
scenarios.correctOption: I can see why you’re concerned about overspending given our recent expenses.
wrongOptions: Why are you so focused on this issue?
We need to stick to our budget without question.

scenarios.scenario: A colleague says, 'Implementing this new tool will disrupt our current workflow.'
scenarios.correctOption: I understand why adopting a new tool feels like a big change for the team.
wrongOptions: Why don’t you just trust that this will work?
We’re implementing this whether you like it or not.

scenarios.scenario: Your landlord informs you, 'Due to market changes, I need to increase the rent.'
scenarios.correctOption: I can see why rising property costs might make this increase feel necessary.
wrongOptions: Why are you increasing the rent now?
This increase is unfair, and I won’t agree to it.

scenarios.scenario: A decision-maker says, 'Your proposal seems too ambitious for us at this time.'
scenarios.correctOption: I get why this proposal might feel risky given your current priorities.
wrongOptions: Why do you think this idea is risky?
Let me explain why there’s no risk involved.

scenarios.scenario: A prospect mentions, 'I'm hesitant to lock into a long-term contract.'
scenarios.correctOption: I understand why you might be hesitant to commit to a long-term subscription.
wrongOptions: Why do you think this isn’t worth it?
Let me explain why this subscription is perfect for you.

scenarios.scenario: A client requests, 'We need a significant discount to move forward.'
scenarios.correctOption: I can see why you’d ask for a discount given your budget constraints.
wrongOptions: Why do you think this product is overpriced?
We can’t offer discounts due to our pricing model.

scenarios.scenario: A customer says, 'I'm not certain this solution fits our unique needs.'
scenarios.correctOption: I understand why you might feel unsure about whether this product fits your needs.
wrongOptions: Why do you think this product won’t work?
Our product is designed to meet a variety of requirements.

scenarios.scenario: An existing client tells you, 'We're not comfortable increasing our order at this time.'
scenarios.correctOption: I get why committing to a larger order might feel like a risk right now.
wrongOptions: Why do you think increasing the order is risky?
Let me explain why increasing the order is a good idea.

scenarios.scenario: A customer notes, 'We can get a similar product for less elsewhere.'
scenarios.correctOption: I understand why their lower price might feel appealing.
wrongOptions: Why do you think their price is better?
Our product offers better value despite the cost.

scenarios.scenario: A client says, 'We need to delay our decision until next quarter.'
scenarios.correctOption: I get why taking more time might feel necessary for such an important decision.
wrongOptions: Why do you think you need more time?
What’s stopping you from deciding now?

scenarios.scenario: A prospect replies, 'We've decided to put this project on hold indefinitely.'
scenarios.correctOption: I can see why you might have had second thoughts after our last conversation.
wrongOptions: Why haven’t you responded to my follow-ups?
Let’s revisit our previous discussion.

scenarios.scenario: A client says, 'Upgrading right now isn't feasible for us.'
scenarios.correctOption: I understand why moving to a higher tier might feel like a big commitment.
wrongOptions: Why don’t you see the value in upgrading?
Let me explain why this higher tier is worth it.

scenarios.scenario: A group of stakeholders expresses, 'We're not sure this solution aligns with our strategy.'
scenarios.correctOption: I can see why it might feel difficult to align this with your team’s goals.
wrongOptions: Why do you think this solution won’t work?
Let me address your concerns one by one.

scenarios.scenario: An executive responds, 'I don't think meeting is necessary at this point.'
scenarios.correctOption: I understand why this might not feel like a priority right now.
wrongOptions: Why don’t you think this meeting is worthwhile?
Let me explain why this is worth your time.

description: These are open-ended questions that begin with 'What' or 'How.' They invite the other party to think and provide valuable insights.
purpose: Uncover priorities, gather information, and encourage problem-solving.

example.scenario: A team member says, 'We can’t meet this deadline.'
example.response: What resources would help us meet the deadline?
example.outcome: The team member shares specific needs, enabling you to find a solution.

scenarios.scenario: During your performance review, you ask for a raise, and your employer responds, 'We can't offer salary increases due to budget constraints.'
scenarios.correctOption: What factors are limiting the budget for salary increases?
wrongOptions: Why can’t you approve my raise?
How can I convince you to adjust the budget?

scenarios.scenario: A customer says, 'Your product's price is beyond our budget.'
scenarios.correctOption: What aspects of the pricing are most concerning to you?
wrongOptions: Why do you think the price is too high?
What would it take to convince you the price is fair?

scenarios.scenario: A supplier tells you, 'We can't extend better terms under our current agreement.'
scenarios.correctOption: What can we do to make offering better terms easier for you?
wrongOptions: Why can’t you just offer better terms?
What do you need from us to justify better terms?

scenarios.scenario: Your coworker mentions, 'I'm overwhelmed with my current workload.'
scenarios.correctOption: How do you think we could distribute the workload more effectively?
wrongOptions: Why do you think the workload is uneven?
What would it take for you to handle your responsibilities?

scenarios.scenario: A client says, 'We can't afford any delays on this project.'
scenarios.correctOption: What challenges would extending the timeline create for you?
wrongOptions: Why don’t you want to approve this extension?
What would it take to get approval for an extension?

scenarios.scenario: A vendor states, 'Providing a discount isn't possible with our current pricing model.'
scenarios.correctOption: What criteria do you use to determine discounts?
wrongOptions: Why can’t you just give us a better price?
How can we get you to agree to our price?

scenarios.scenario: Your partner says, 'I'm concerned about how much we're spending on dining out.'
scenarios.correctOption: What expenses are most concerning to you right now?
wrongOptions: Why do you think we’re overspending?
How can I convince you we’re managing our money well?

scenarios.scenario: A team member remarks, 'I'm not convinced this new software will help us.'
scenarios.correctOption: What concerns do you have about adopting this new tool?
wrongOptions: Why don’t you believe this tool will work?
What will it take to convince you to try this tool?

scenarios.scenario: Your landlord notifies you, 'Due to increased costs, I'm raising your rent next month.'
scenarios.correctOption: What factors are influencing the decision to raise the rent?
wrongOptions: Why are you raising the rent?
How can we convince you to keep the rent stable?

scenarios.scenario: In a meeting, a stakeholder says, 'We're hesitant to approve this project.'
scenarios.correctOption: What concerns do you have about moving forward with this idea?
wrongOptions: Why do you think this idea won’t work?
What will it take to convince you to approve this idea?

scenarios.scenario: A prospect says, 'I'm not ready to commit to a subscription right now.'
scenarios.correctOption: What factors are making you hesitant to sign up?
wrongOptions: Why don’t you think this service is worth it?
How can I convince you to try the subscription?

scenarios.scenario: A potential client says, 'We need a lower price to proceed with this purchase.'
scenarios.correctOption: What aspects of our product make you feel it’s worth less than the current price?
wrongOptions: Why do you think our product is overpriced?
What would it take to justify this price to you?

scenarios.scenario: During a product demo, the client mentions, 'I'm not sure this will integrate with our systems.'
scenarios.correctOption: What specific features do you feel might not meet your needs?
wrongOptions: Why do you think this product won’t work for you?
What would it take to prove this product is right for you?

scenarios.scenario: An existing client says, 'We can't commit to increasing our order size right now.'
scenarios.correctOption: What challenges do you foresee with increasing your order size?
wrongOptions: Why don’t you want to place a larger order?
How can we convince you to increase the order size?

scenarios.scenario: A customer says, 'Your competitor offers similar features at a lower cost.'
scenarios.correctOption: What factors are most important to you besides cost?
wrongOptions: Why do you think their lower price is better?
How can we convince you that our product offers more value?

scenarios.scenario: A client mentions, 'We need more time to make a decision on this proposal.'
scenarios.correctOption: What information would help you make a more confident decision?
wrongOptions: Why do you think you need more time?
How can we speed up your decision-making process?

scenarios.scenario: After reaching out, a prospect replies, 'We've had to shift our focus elsewhere.'
scenarios.correctOption: What changed since we last spoke?
wrongOptions: Why haven’t you responded to my emails?
How can we reignite your interest in our product?

scenarios.scenario: A client says, 'I'm hesitant to upgrade to a higher-tier package.'
scenarios.correctOption: What additional value would you need to see to consider upgrading?
wrongOptions: Why don’t you think upgrading is worth it?
How can I convince you to choose the higher tier?

scenarios.scenario: During a sales pitch, a decision-maker says, 'We're not convinced this solution fits our needs.'
scenarios.correctOption: What aspects of this solution do you feel don’t align with your team’s goals?
wrongOptions: Why don’t you think this solution will work?
What will it take to convince everyone this is the right solution?

scenarios.scenario: An executive responds to your pitch with, 'I'm not interested in scheduling a meeting at this time.'
scenarios.correctOption: What would make this meeting valuable for you?
wrongOptions: Why don’t you think this meeting is worthwhile?
How can I convince you to agree to the meeting?
